body.p: I am exceedingly sorry to say, in reply to your note, that it is quite out of my power to give you the employment you seek. I believe my publishers facilitate the German translationsFor translations up to 1841, see Pilgrim Letters 2, p. 43n. of my writings, by sending early sheets to certain German Booksellers.Publishers of translations included Weber and Wigand of Leipzig, Franckh and Krabbe of Stuttgart, and Vieweg of Brunswick: see Pilgrim Letters 4 p. 17n. But this is matter of arrangement between them. The books are translated in Germany; and the enterprise is not mine, or my publishers, but originated with German houses of business.
